oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Complexity of the Game Domination Problem
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Brešar, Boštjan
Dorbec, Paul
Klavžar, Sandi
Košmrlj, Gašper
Renault, Gabriel
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Combinatorics
Computer Science - Computational Complexity
05C57, 68Q15, 05C69
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The game domination number is a graph invariant that arises from a game, which is related to graph domination in a similar way as the game chromatic number is related to graph coloring. In this paper we show that verifying whether the game domination number of a graph is bounded by a given integer is PSPACE-complete. This contrasts the situation of the game coloring problem whose complexity is still unknown.
